definition: disciple/apprentice/believer/on foot/bare or empty/to no avail/only/prison sentence

sentences.english: The gangsters sprayed the car with machinegun bullets.
sentences.chinese: 匪徒们用机枪狂扫汽车。

sentences.english: He drove the police car at full throttle and dashed at the gangsters.
sentences.chinese: 他驾驶着警车开足马力向匪徒冲去。

sentences.english: Two of the bandits were killed on the spot.
Justice, as well as the law, demands that these bandits be severely punished.
sentences.chinese: 法律和正义都要求严办这些匪徒。

sentences.english: The policemen were hunting gangsters in the forest.
sentences.chinese: 警察们正在森林中搜捕匪徒。

sentences.english: The thugs' cruelty is the pet hate of the farmers in the neighbourhood.
sentences.chinese: 附近的农户对匪徒之残毒恨之入骨。

sentences.english: The angel told the evangelist's evangel to a gang of fanged gangling gangsters.
sentences.chinese: 天使把福音传道者的佳音传给一伙有毒牙的瘦长匪徒。
匪徒们联手在上半场拿到了15分。

sentences.english: The bandits despoiled the villagers of their belongings.
sentences.chinese: 匪徒们夺去村民们的财物。

sentences.english: The bank was carefully cased by the bandits before the robbery.
sentences.chinese: 银行在抢劫案发生之前曾被匪徒彻底勘查过。

sentences.english: You may run into Kingston and get gun shot, " he said."
sentences.chinese: “你可能会碰到金斯敦，并得到匪徒中枪，”他说。

sentences.english: All the bandits that invaded the border area have been wiped out.
sentences.chinese: 窜犯边境的匪徒已全部被歼。

sentences.english: Their flying speeds are used by a group of mobsters to deliver dynamite.
sentences.chinese: 一帮匪徒却利用他们飞一般的速度来运送炸弹。

sentences.english: The bandits descended upon the defenceless village.
sentences.chinese: 匪徒袭击无防御的村庄。

sentences.english: Thenardier was a ruffian in the eyes of all the world except Marius.
sentences.chinese: 所有的人，除了马吕斯之外，都认为德纳第是个匪徒。

sentences.english: St. Moses the Ethiopian led a gang of cutthroats in the Egyptian desert.
sentences.chinese: 圣摩西曾经带领一帮匪徒在埃及沙漠里火拼。

definition: horse thief/(old) group of horse-mounted bandits
